alert.note: Alert for Castro; Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 01 at 3:24AM CST until March 01 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 7 PM CST this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Timing...Noon to 7 PM CST today. * Wind...Southwest to south winds at 15 to 25 mph and gusts to 40 mph. * Humidity...10 to 15 percent. * Fuels...Dry to Critically dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
